title: Cuban doctors come to the rescue of hospitals in Italy's Calabria
description: No strangers to emergency assignments, Cuban doctors are now being sent to public hospitals in Europe. Havana, which earns valuable foreign currency by exporting its medical staff, has reached an agreement with Italy's poorest region, Calabria.

title: Boris Johnson resigns as UK lawmaker
description: The ex-prime minister quit after receiving the results of an investigation by MPs over misleading statements he made to Parliament about the so-called 'Partygate' scandal.

title: Trump indicted on 37 counts over confidential documents found at Mar-a-Lago
description: Former US president Donald Trump could have 'put at risk the national security of the United States,' said the Department of Justice.

title: Paris 2024: Game organizers rely on  fan zones to 'bring the party to the people'
description: Local authorities around the country have shown interest in establishing '2024 Clubs,' which are designated gathering spaces approved by the organizers of the Olympic and Paralympic Games.

title: Annecy knife attack: Suspect was refused Swedish citizenship because of Syrian military past
description: According to his ex-wife, Abdelmasih H., who stabbed several children in the French Alps on Thursday, left Sweden because he could not obtain citizenship.

title: French Open: Djokovic beats cramping Alcaraz to reach final
description: Novak Djokovic won in four sets (6-2, 5-7, 6-1, 6-1) against a pain-stricken Carlos Alcaraz in the semifinal at Roland Garros.

title: EU Commission clears Vivendi buying Lagardère in publishing competition case
description: The deal will happen on the condition that Vivendi sells off the Editis publishing business and the Gala celebrity magazine.

title: Canada wildfires: Smoke slows activity in eastern US cities, reaches Norway
description: The sky began to clear in New York City, but there are still 150 active fires in the province of Quebec.

title: ICJ allows Ukraine allies to join court case against Russia
description: Ukraine has alleged before the International Court of Justice that Russia broached the UN genocide convention, in a case that could take months or year.

title: Macron was given 'positive' news on condition of children wounded in Annecy knife attack
description: The French president and his wife Brigitte travelled to the southeastern city of Grenoble, where three of the children are being treated.

title: 'Everything indicates' Russia is behind Ukraine's dam breach says EU top diplomat
description: Moscow and Kyiv have accused each other of blowing up the dam in what resulted in massive flooding and the evacuation of thousands of civilians earlier this week.

title: France has a persistent social divide according to inequality monitor
description: In its latest report, published on June 8, the Observatoire des Inégalités paints a picture of a country where gaps in income levels and living standards between the most affluent and the least affluent are widening.

title: Who can save Hvaldimir, the wandering beluga whale?
description: Suspected of spying for Russia when it was discovered in 2019, the 12-year-old whale continues to stray further south. Norwegian NGO OneWhale, which has been tracking him for the past four years, is concerned about his behavior.

title: Macron visits children wounded in Annecy knife attack
description: The French president and his wife Brigitte arrived in the southeastern city of Grenoble, where three of the children are being treated.

title: Ukraine says fighting mainly in east, clashes reported in south
description: Ukrainian officials said the country's east was the 'epicenter' of fighting, while Russia said there had been clashes in the south, near Zaporizhzhia in particular.

title: Drone hits residential building in Russian city of Voronezh, says governor
description: Two people were injured in the attack, the latest in a series that have hit Russian cities in recent months as Kyiv says it is preparing for a major counteroffensive.

title: French Open 2023: Alcaraz versus Djokovic, 'the match everyone's waiting for'
description: The Spanish player (world no. 1) and the Serbian player (no. 3) will battle it out on Friday for a place in the tournament final. It's the clash of the titans that has had both players salivating since the draw.

title: Trump is benefiting from the increasingly crowded 2024 Republican nomination race
description: The former US president's main opponent, Ron DeSantis, has failed to establish himself as a credible alternative, encouraging other figures to try their luck, such as former vice president Mike Pence and former New Jersey governor Chris Christie.

title: French right and far right jostle for political advantage following knife attack in Annecy
description: Politicians of the Républicains, Rassemblement National and Reconquête parties were quick to insist on the profile of the attacker, a Syrian refugee, to criticize the government over its migration policy.

title: Annecy knife attack: When the children's laughter fell silent
description: Two children and one adult were still in critical condition on Friday morning after a knife attack in a park in the French Alps. Videos by local residents track scenes of horror.

title: Five themed hikes in the footsteps of bears and among vineyards
description: Le Monde is taking you on a trip, so put on your walking shoes. From Crozon to Paris, the Pic Saint-Loup to the Pyrenees, you'll admire contemporary art in the great outdoors, toast the social revolution and give herbalism a try.

title: Alain Touraine, a leading French sociologist, has died
description: Touraine, who worked extensively on issues around labor, feminism and capitalism in France and abroad, died in Paris on Friday, his daughter said. He was 97.

title: Annecy knife attack: Suspect Abdelmessih H. is a Christian Syrian refugee who arrived from Sweden
description: Born in 1991, he left his country in 2011 after the civil war broke out. He moved to Sweden where he was granted refugee status in 2013. His asylum application in France was denied on June 4.

title: Heat and drought return to parts of France
description: This spring has seen unusual weather and varied rainfall across different French regions. In the northern half of the country, the sun and wind have negated the benefit of April's rains.

title: French forests, a crucial carbon sink, are in peril
description: The CO₂ storage capacity of forest ecosystems has halved in 10 years. It's a worrying trend, at a time when France is due to revise its strategy aimed at achieving carbon neutrality.

title: Sudan declares UN envoy Volker Perthes 'persona non grata'
description: On Thursday, June 8, Volker Perthes, head of the United Nations integrated transition assistance mission in Sudan, has been accused by Karthoum of stoking the country's conflict.

title: Planet Earth warming at 'unprecedented rate'
description: According to a study published on Thursday, June 8, the amount of greenhouse gases humanity can emit while remaining under the threshold of 1.5°C has been halved compared with the previous estimate.

title: 'I'm gender-fluid: I oscillate between masculinity and femininity, it's pretty blurry'
description: Rose, an 18-year-old student, reflects on her passage to adulthood, recounting how she has been shifting between genders since she was 15.

title: Côte d'Azur choppers keep ignoring French transport minister's orders
description: What happens to the stories once they've been published? This week, Le Monde looks back at the unwelcome helicopter flights around Saint-Tropez that caught the attention of Minister Clément Beaune.

title: Annecy in shock after knife attack
description: On the morning of Thursday, June 8, a man seriously injured four preschoolers and two adults in Annecy's Pâquier park. After the initial shock, local residents are now trying to understand what happened.

title: Trump indicted in classified docs probe, according to former president's social media account
description: Donald Trump declared on Truth Social on Thursday, June 8th he’d been indicted on charges of mishandling classified documents at his Mar-a-Lago residence. This federal prosecution is arguably the most perilous of multiple legal threats against him as he seeks to reclaim the White House.
